SEARCH

Class TicTacToeServer

java.lang.Object
TicTacToeServer
public class TicTacToeServer extends Object
The TicTacToeServer program implements a Tic-Tac-Toe Server. This process handles the requests from the clients and relay to the GameManager. This process also interprets messages from GameManager and sends to clients. Each TicTacToeServer is only associated with one GameManager. That is, there can only be one game and no more than 2 clients at any time. Upon disconnection of 2 existing clients, the GameManager will be reset and a new game is initialized for new clients.
Since:
2024-12-05
Version:
1.0
Author:
Vincent Tong

    • displayMoveAndGameContinue

      public void displayMoveAndGameContinue(String Role, int x, int y)
      Tell the clients about the change of the grids and instructs clients to continue the game. There is a move but there is no winner or draw yet.
      Parameters:
      Role - Who has just moved (O or X)
      x - X coordinate of the grid that has just been occupied
      y - Y coordinate of the grid that has just been occupied

    • displayMoveAndGameOver

      public void displayMoveAndGameOver(String Winner, String Role, int x, int y, int NumOfWinO, int NumOfWinX, int NumOfDraw)
      Tell the clients about the change of the grids and instructs clients to stop the game. There is a move and there is a winner or a draw.
      Parameters:
      Winner - Who wins the game (O, X or Draw)
      Role - Who has just moved (O or X)
      x - X coordinate of the grid that has just been occupied
      y - Y coordinate of the grid that has just been occupied
      NumOfWinO - Number of wins of O
      NumOfWinX - Number of wins of X
      NumOfDraw - Number of draws
